author: xtremekaxiumcycler12
title: Very awesome.
review:
This is such a great set. At first I was angry that bionicle ended, but then i bought 2 HERO factory sets and discovered how absolutly pants they are. I'm Hooked!

  • Pros
  • tons of new parts
  • Starts an amazing new line
  • fun to make stop motion with
  • very solid and strong looking

 

  • Cons
  • Price...
  • Only HALF of a weapon is dissapointing.

 

Overall... a Great way to spend your money

author: Toa_Daiker
title: Hero Stringer: Most skilled and Advanced Hero
review:
Let me just say that Stringer is my favorite Hero. He has a pretty simple build but the look pays up for it. He is a nice thick hero, and if I had to describe him in one word it would be solid. Now onto the pros and cons:

Pros:
  • Great color scheme
  • Cool mask
  • Nice thick build
  • Awesome Sonic Weapon
  • cool chest design
  • Cool helmet
Cons:
  • Short build
  • 3 limbs
Hero Jimi Stringer is an awesome set. My advice: Buy him!

author: e2mtt
title: Hero Factory? give me some articulation...
review:
I got this because I wanted to try out at least one Hero Factory unit - 


The helmet design is awesome, & the overall look of Jimi Stringer is really cool. The black & orange color scheme is great.


However, I hate this set. It falls short as both an action hero toy, & as a lego set. I mean, c',mon. No bendable knees or elbows? Fists that can't grab anything? (Other than inserting a technic axle) No right arm, just a 1-piece molded gun/arm that that can't be set down, can't be used to hold or grab anything, doesn't have any hardpoints that would allow additional Lego parts to be modded onto the gun, and is molded so that only the outside looks good anyway. (Lego won't ever do any publicity shots of this guy showing his left side!)


Very disappointing, & I won't be buying any more Hero Factory sets. At a price point of about $.44 per piece on these sets, I don't understand why Lego couldn't have broken them up into a few more smaller pieces, just for more playability.

author: legostarwarsfan2010
title: black hero Jim Stringer!!

This is one of my favroute bionicles[not a bionicle but, no matter] and is very good at only £7.99.it is the most powerful hero in the hero factory.

overall a great set. If you want 1 then go to argos or tesco

author: KodakKid365
title: Not bad
review: Stringer has a very cool color design. His weapon is pretty cool. Something very cool you can do if you have Stringer and Stormer is if you take all the blue trims and replace them with Stringer's orange trim so he is blue and black. It makes him look awesome.

author: unleashed
title: Not satisfactory!
review: The blaster Stringer has makes it look like it can shoot in a different direction. it is also totally chopped in half. And his armor: come on! he needs more on his arms. I didn't like hero factory at first anyways, and I just got this for Christmas. I knew I shouldan't have opened it!

author: tkettle9719
title: Hero Factory: Ruining my Bionicle Childhood
review:
I received this set from my uncle on Easter, and thought that this was the ruining of my childhood. This set is okay, but is nowhere near the awesomeness of Bionicle, especially because of a loss of story...

Pros

  • -The orange-black color scheme is unusually good.
  • -The core is also cool, as it is easily removable for easy play.
  • …

Cons

  • -The legs and arms are very limited in what they can do.
  • -The weapon appears flat, and wimpy.
  • …

I guess that this set is okay for a Hero Factory set, but if this is what the series after Bionicle is evolving into, I'm really disappointed.

author: 123MrBrick
title: A Fair 1.0
review:
I bought Stringer when he first came out and 7.99 was a great price. He has amazing quality, but the articulation is limited.

Box/Instructions

This set comes packed in a canister, similar to the late sets of the Bionicle line up. The front has a nice image of Jimi Stringer with some blueprints and writing. The back shows him battling his arch-nemesis, Meltdown. 'From the makers of Bionicle' is on both sides. The problem is the parts are loose in the canister, which could lead to damage to some of the fragile armor bits. The label is also prone to peeling.

Parts

This set doesn't have very many parts, as you are simply assembling a humanoid robot. There are no bricks, just Bionicle-style robot pieces. Jimi features a unique mask and chest piece as well as his own style of cannon. The rest of the parts are shared with other Heroes and villains from the 2010 line up. The Hero Core is a very interesting piece, and was only used for the 2010 Heroes.

 

The build

Not much to this part.... just snap together the pieces with the ball joints and then push on a couple of armor parts that feature technic push-ins.

The completed model

The completed robot mode is stunning and features bright colors. The stock photos here on Brickset don't do it justice. The only real problem is the limited articulation due to the large covering parts. Other than that, it looks great and slightly menacing, even though Stringer is definitly a good guy!

Overall opinion

A nice looking figure, easy build, just bad articulation. This one is hard to come by nowadays, so try and get one for cheap. I recommend this figure to any HF fan.
